title: Oil Industry Contemplates World Without Russian Crude
sub_head: Crude traders brace for disruption if Western countries ban imports of Russian oil
body:
As oil prices shoot to levels unseen since before the 2008 financial crisis, the energy industry is asking a previously unthinkable question: How would it cope if it has to forgo Russian oil?
Crude prices rose briefly to almost $140 a barrel, grain prices leapt and industrial metals rallied on Monday as war in Ukraine and the Westâ€™s response threatened to hit supplies of commodities that underpin much of the global economy. The surge builds on weeks of gains for raw materials and stands to add to inflationary pressures world-wide.
